intro: Loasa acutiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved loasa, is a perennial shrub native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Loasa acutiloba is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, making it a hardy and resilient plant in arid environments.
